txt.en: 'No matter how well Iphantemel has defended her den, it lies on the forest's edge and has but one way in or out. I deem it best, for now, to station a watch of keen-eyed archers in view of it, and pin the spiders in where they can do least harm.\n\n'Will you aid us in these efforts, [placeholder]?'
I deem it best, for now, to station a watch of keen-eyed archers.
My archers are setting out at once.
With Iphantemel besieged, she must face starvation within or flight
You should talk to Thranduil in Felegoth.
'With Iphantemel besieged, she must face starvation within or flight onto the battleground of our choosing. Either must be her end.'
Thranduil has a plan to besiege Iphantemel's den in Torech Emel.
'My archers are setting out at once, led by Oroniel. You should join them with all haste.'
You should talk to Thranduil in Felegoth.
